books.title: Classical Mechanics
books.author: Goldstein, Herbert; Poole, Charles; Safko, John
books.description: The definitive graduate textbook on classical mechanics. Covers Lagrangian and Hamiltonian mechanics, canonical transformations, Hamilton-Jacobi theory, and an introduction to chaos and nonlinear dynamics. The third edition adds coverage of nonlinear dynamics and chaos.

books.title: General Relativity
books.author: Wald, Robert M.
books.description: The rigorous graduate treatment of general relativity. Wald develops GR from a geometric perspective using differential forms and the abstract index notation. Includes coverage of singularity theorems, black holes, quantum field theory in curved spacetime, and the initial value formulation.

books.title: Gravitational Lenses
books.author: Schneider, Peter; Ehlers, Jürgen; Falco, Emilio E.
books.description: The definitive textbook on gravitational lensing theory. Covers the full theoretical framework from the geodesic equation to microlensing, strong lensing, and weak lensing. Essential reference for anyone working in the field.

books.title: Modern Cosmology
books.author: Dodelson, Scott
books.description: A comprehensive graduate treatment of modern cosmology. Covers the expanding universe, inflation, the CMB, dark matter and dark energy, gravitational lensing, and large-scale structure. Chapter 9 on gravitational lensing is particularly thorough.

books.title: Introduction to Electrodynamics
books.author: Griffiths, David J.
books.description: The standard undergraduate electrodynamics textbook. Griffiths covers electrostatics, magnetostatics, electrodynamics, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic waves, and special relativity with clarity and physical insight. Widely regarded as one of the best physics textbooks ever written.

books.title: Introduction to Quantum Mechanics
books.author: Griffiths, David J.; Schroeter, Darrell F.
books.description: The most widely used undergraduate quantum mechanics textbook. Covers the Schrödinger equation, formalism, quantum mechanics in three dimensions, identical particles, and introductory applications. Griffiths's trademark lucid prose makes difficult material accessible.

books.title: Classical Electrodynamics
books.author: Jackson, John David
books.description: The canonical graduate electrodynamics text. Jackson's book is comprehensive and challenging, covering boundary value problems, multipole radiation, relativistic electrodynamics, plasma physics, and MHD. Infamous for its difficult problems — a rite of passage for physics graduate students.

books.title: Spacetime and Geometry: An Introduction to General Relativity
books.author: Carroll, Sean M.
books.description: A modern and pedagogically excellent introduction to general relativity. Carroll carefully develops the differential geometry needed, then applies it to GR, black holes, gravitational waves, and cosmology. Based on his popular online lecture notes, this is an ideal first GR text.

books.title: Mathematical Methods for Physics and Engineering
books.author: Riley, K.F.; Hobson, M.P.; Bence, S.J.
books.description: A comprehensive mathematical methods text covering linear algebra, vector calculus, Fourier series, PDEs, complex analysis, group theory, and more. Thorough and well-organized, ideal for physics and engineering students needing a complete mathematical toolkit.

books.title: The Cosmic Microwave Background
books.author: Durrer, Ruth
books.description: This text examines the theory of the CMB and its recent progress. It start with a brief introduction to modern cosmology and its main successes, followed by a thorough derivation of cosmological perturbation theory. It then explores the generation of initial fluctuations by inflation. In the following chapters the Boltzmann equation, which governs the evolution of CMB anisotropies, and polarization are derived using the total angular momentum method. Cosmological parameter estimation is discussed in detail. The lensing of CMB fluctuations and spectral distortions are also treated.

books.title: The Geometry of Physics: An Introduction
books.author: Frankel, Theodore
books.description: This book is intended to provide a working knowledge of those parts of exterior differential forms, differential geometry, algebraic and differential topology, Lie groups, vector bundles, and Chern forms that are essential for a deeper understanding of both classical and modern physics and engineering.

books.title: The Space Environment and Its Effects on Space Systems
books.author: Pisacane, Vincent L.
books.description: This book explores the physics of the space environment and engineering aspects of the effects of the space environment on space systems.

books.title: The Night Sky Observer's Guide: Volume 1
books.author: Kepple, George Robert; Sanner, Glen W.
books.description: This book give history and context to every noteable object in every constellation in the sky!
